PROJECTS.MANDATORY_LANGS_INFO: Mandatory languages are expected to be covered extensively in the dataset. Some features of the platform (e.g. ICV) support verification of this constraint

PROJ_GROUP.PROJ_CLOSED_WARNING: Project {{projName}} is closed. It is possible to edit group settings only for open projects.
PROJ_GROUP.SCHEME_AUTH_INFO: Determines which ConceptScheme the group is authorized to work with.
PROJ_GROUP.OWL_PROJECT_WARNING: Project {{projName}} adopts OWL model. Currently it is possible to edit group settings only for SKOS projects.

GROUPS.RESTRICTIONS_INFO: If enabled, the user is subject to the group limitations

LANGS.LANG_PROFICIENCIES_INFO: This language is in the language proficiencies of the selected user
LANGS.LANGUAGE_ADMIN_INFO: For administrator user, no language assigned implicitly means all project languages
LANGS.SHOW_ONLY_PROFICIENCIES: Show only language proficiencies of the user

TEMPLATE.RES_VIEW_TEMPLATE_DESCRIPTION: Here you can customize the ResourceView template for the user in the given project. Note: this is exactly the setting of the user, so by changing it you will change directly its ResourceView template.

SYSTEM.INTRO: In this section you can setup some core aspects of the system. This panel can be accessed also later from Administration > Configuration (located in the user menu)
SYSTEM.ST_DATA_FOLDER_INFO: Provide the SemanticTurkey data folder path. This can be absolute or relative to the SemanticTurkey installation folder.
SYSTEM.PRELOAD_THRESHOLD_INFO: Tells the threshold file size (in bytes) admitted by the preload profiler during the project creation. If unspecified, or 0, the default size is 1048576 bytes (1 megabyte).
SYSTEM.ENABLE_EXPERIMENTAL_FEATURES_INFO: Check this option in order to enable experimental (very unstable) features

EMAIL.VB_EMAIL_CONFIG_INFO: Configuration of the VocBench e-mail service. This service will be used to send notifications to the system administrator and to the users
EMAIL.AUTHENTICATION_INFO: True if SMTP server requires authentication
EMAIL.MAIL_FROM: Email address used to send administration emails
EMAIL.MAIL_PASSWORD: Password of the above email address
EMAIL.MAIL_ALIAS: Alias name shown in the administration emails

NOTIFICATIONS.NOTIFICATION_SCHEDULER_INFO: Configuration of the VocBench e-mail notification service. The system will send a notifications daily digest to the users who have chosen the Email daily digest as notification mode.
NOTIFICATIONS.HOURS_OF_DAY_INFO: The hour of the day when the report will be sent every day

REGISTRATION_FORM.OPTIONAL_FIELDS_INFO: Show or hide optional information about the user. These information will be shown or hidden in the user overview and will be also prompted as non-mandatory fields during the user creation/registration.
REGISTRATION_FORM.CUSTOM_FIELDS_INFO:
Add (and reorder) up to {{maxFields}} custom information about the user. These information will be shown in the user overview and will be also prompted as non-mandatory fields during the user creation/registration.
If a field is removed, any values previously stored for that field will be lost for any user.
If a field is renamed, any values previously stored for that field will be preserved.

HOME_PAGE.HOME_CONTENT_INFO: Here you can write HTML-formatted text content that will be shown in the home page

USERS.ADMIN_ASSIGNED_PROJECTS_INFO: Administrator has autmoatically access to all projects
USERS.FORCE_PASSWORD_WARNING:
This procedure will force the change of {{userShow}}'s password.
Note: A forgot password procedure already exists (available in the login form). It is recommended to let the user update its own password through that procedure. Use this procedure only if strictly necessary.
USERS.TEMPLATE_INFO:
Here you can assign a ResourceView template to the user. This template describes which ResourceView partitions are visible by default.
You can also load an already existing template, or decide to save the template you defined, through the toolbar in panel header.

HOME.DESCRIPTION: VocBench is a web-based, multilingual, collaborative development platform for managing OWL ontologies, SKOS(/XL) thesauri, Ontolex-lemon lexicons and generic RDF datasets.
HOME.POWERED_BY: VocBench is powered by the Semantic Turkey Knowledge Acquisition and Management framework

FUNDED_BY.TITLE: VocBench 3 is funded by
FUNDED_BY.ISA2_SUBTITLE: Interoperability solutions for public administrations, business and citizens
FUNDED_BY.OP_NAME: Publications Office of the European Union

COLLABORATION.UNCONFIGURED_FOR_PROJECT: The Collaboration System has not been configured for this project.
COLLABORATION.NO_RESOURCE_ASSOCIATED: No resource(s) associated to this issue

UNCONFIGURED_CS.UNCONFIGURED_CS_WARNING: No Collaboration System has been configured.

UNSIGNED_USER.UNSIGNED_USER_WARNING: You need to be logged to the CS in order to see the issues list.

UNASSIGNED_PROJ.UNASSIGNED_PROJ_WARNING: There is no CS project assigned to this Vocbench project.

COLLABORATION.CS_NOT_WORKING_WARNING: Collaboration System seems to be configured but it is not working. Please, check that the configuration is valid, or be sure that the CS server is running.

FORMS.NAME_INFO: The name that will be shown to the user to identify this form
FORMS.DESCRIPTION_INFO: A natural language description that briefly explain the purpose of this form
FORMS.REF_INFO: In case of Graph type this should contain a PEARL rule otherwise, in case of Node type, this should contain simply a PEARL projection operator
FORMS.SHOW_PROP_CHAIN_INFO: A property chain to follow to retrieve the value to be shown to represent the graph generated by means of this Form

PEARL_INFERENCE_VALIDATION.WARNING_MSG:
Note: in case no annotation has been inferred, the two PEARL might not differ at all. Anyway, the inference process might apply changes, such as reordering the prefix definitions and removing comments.
It is also possible to edit the resulting PEARL before applying the changes.

COLLECTIONS.SUGGESTIONS_INFO: Property/Classes suggested to use with this FormCollection

CONFIG.REPLACE_INFO: Tells if the CustomForm replaces the 'default' form. Valid only for CustomRanges (not CustomConstructors)

CUSTOM_SERVICES.FORCE_RELOAD_INFO: Reload services (useful when the Custom Services are changed/loaded manually)

INTRO: The parameters are mapped to variables with the same name in the SPARQL query. Actual parameters passed to a service upon invocation are pre-bound to the corresponding variable in the SPARQL query. A reserved variable is
which is bound by default to the working graph of the project.
PARAM_HELPER.ALLOWED_RETURN_TYPE: The allowed return type depends on the actual SPARQL operation
PARAM_HELPER.T_TYPE_OTP1: might be any of the above accepted parameter types (in this case the SELECT must return one variable)
T_TYPE_OPT2_ADDENDA: in this case the SELECT must return one variable plus additional variables

TYPE_RESTR.TYPE_RESTRICTION_INFO: Determines if the rdf capability is required on a specific resource type. It is possible to select a type among those available in VB or to let the system infer the type from a parameter of the operation.
TYPE_RESTR.RESTRICTION_TO_PARAMETER_TYPE: Restrict to the type of a parameter

LANG_REQUIREMENT.LANGUAGE_REQUIREMENT_INFO: Determines if the operation requires that the user which performs the operation has a specific language assigned. It is possible to select a language among those available in VB or to let the system infer it from a parameter of the operation.
LANG_REQUIREMENT.REQUIRE_PARAMETER_LANG: Require the language of a parameter

AUTH_HELPER.SCOPE_INFO: Refines the scope of the selected type
AUTH_HELPER.NO_PARAM_OPERATION: The operation does not foreseen any parameter
AUTH_HELPER.CAPABILITIES_DOCUMENTATION_REF: For further details about the capability vocabulary, please refer to the VB documentation.

SERVICE.SERVICE_NAME_INFO: The name used to group all operations defined by this custom service
SERVICE.DESCRIPTION_INFO: A description of this custom service

CLASS.SHOW_MODEL_GRAPH_ROOTED: Show model-oriented graph rooted on the selected node

SETTINGS.SUBCLASS_FILTER_INFO: Here you can create filters in order to hide subClasses of classes

CONCEPT.ADD_SUBTREE_TO_SCHEME: Add selected concept's subtree to scheme...
CONCEPT.NO_SCHEME_SELECTED_WARN: No ConceptScheme selected, creation operations are disabled
CONCEPT.USE_SEARCH_MSG: Please use the search field to retrieve concepts

SETTINGS.TOP_CONCEPTS_LIMIT_INFO: Sets the maximum amount of top concepts visible in the tree. This setting prevents the initialization of a tree that might cause performance issues
SETTINGS.TOGGLE_OR_AND: Toggles between OR and AND scheme-based filter of concepts in the concept tree
SETTINGS.BASE_BROADER_PROP_INFO: Base broader property to be selected when creating narrower concepts
SETTINGS.BROADER_NARROWER_MGMT_INFO: Customizes the properties on which the concept tree hierarchy is based on. If none of broader/narrower properties is selected, then skos:broader^ and skos:narrower will be used (in OR) to check narrower concepts. If any of the two is selected (with one or more properties), then only the selected properties will be used.
SETTINGS.SYNC_INV_PROP_INFO: Keep synced the broader/narrower properties with their inverse properties
SETTINGS.INCLUDE_SUBPROP_INFO: Includes the subProperties of the selected broader/narrower properties

LEX_ENTRY.NO_LEXICON_SELECTED_WARN: No Lexicon selected, creation operations are disabled
LEX_ENTRY.USE_SEARCH_MSG: Please use the search field to retrieve lexical entries

SETTINGS.LEX_ENTRIES_LIMIT_INFO: Sets the maximum amount of lexical entries visible in the list. This setting prevents the initialization of a list that might cause performance issues

SCHEME.ADD_ALL_CONCEPTS: Add all concepts to the selected scheme

COMMONS.ADD_PROP_VALUE_TO_SELECTION: Add a property value to selected resources

EXPORT.NO_GRAPHS_EXPORTED_MSG: If no graph is selected, all named graphs will be exported
EXPORT.TRANSFORMERS_DESCRIPTION: Here it is possible to create and configure a sequence of transformations to be applied during the export process. Each transformer is applied to a subset of the exported graphs. No graph means every exported graph

LOAD.IMPORTS_RESOLUTION_INFO: Specify the resolution source in case of transitive imports
LOAD.TRANSFORMERS_DESCRIPTION: Here it is possible to create and configure a sequence of transformers to be applied during the load process.
LOAD.FORCE_FORMAT_INFO: Allows forcing the selection of a format overriding the one detected by the system

REFACTOR.SKOS_TO_SKOSXL_INFO: This refactor operation transforms all the SKOS labels and notes into reified SKOS-XL labels and notes.
REFACTOR.SKOSXL_TO_SKOS_INFO: This refactor operation transforms all the reified SKOS-XL labels and notes into flattened SKOS labels and notes. Note: this is NOT a loss-less operation, all the information related to the SKOS-XL labels and notes will be lost.
REFACTOR.MIGRATE_INFO: This operation will move the content of the default graph to a graph named after the base URI of the current project. It will also clear the default graph and preserve the information already contained in the destination graph.

VERSIONING.DUMP_NEW_VERSION_DIFFERENT_LOCATION: Dump a new version to a different location

GRAPHS.EXPORT_SNAPSHOT: Export a snapshot of the graph (.svg)

SETTINGS.PARTITION_FILTER_INFO: Select the partition of the resource description that will be shown when expanding a node.
SETTINGS.HIDE_LITERAL_NODES_INFO: If checked, all the literal nodes will be hidden in the graph

LINKS_FILTER.TOO_MUCH_RELATIONS_WARNING: The resource you are expanding has a big amount of relations, thus it would generate a lot of links and nodes that could confuse the graph visualization. It is highly recommended to filter out some relations in order to limit the graph size.

HISTORY_VALIDATION.PROVIDE_COMMENT: Provide a comment for the validation action

DANGLING_CONCEPTS.NAME: Dangling concepts
DANGLING_CONCEPTS.DESCRIPTION: skos:Concept(s) that have no skos:broader or are not skos:topConceptOf in the skos:ConceptScheme where they belong

OMITTED_TOP_CONCEPT.NAME: ConceptScheme without topConcept
OMITTED_TOP_CONCEPT.DESCRIPTION: skos:ConceptScheme(s) that don't have a topConcept or that are simply empty

CONCEPT_IN_NO_SCHEME.NAME: Concepts in no scheme
CONCEPT_IN_NO_SCHEME.DESCRIPTION: skos:Concept(s) that doesn't belong to any scheme
CONCEPT_IN_NO_SCHEME.WARNING: Warning: adding the concept to a skos:ConceptScheme may be not enough to ensure that it is visible in the concept tree. The concept may be still dangling.

TOP_CONCEPT_WITH_BROADER.NAME: TopConcept with broader
TOP_CONCEPT_WITH_BROADER.DESCRIPTION: skos:Concept(s) that are skos:topConceptOf some scheme and have some skos:broader concept

CONCEPTS_RELATED_DISJOINT.NAME: Concepts related disjoint relations
CONCEPTS_RELATED_DISJOINT.DESCRIPTION: skos:Concept(s) connected to another with both the skos:related and the skos:broaderTransitive (skos:related relation is disjoint with skos:broaderTransitive)

CONCEPT_EXACT_MATCH_DISJOINT.NAME: Concepts exactMatch disjoint relations
CONCEPT_EXACT_MATCH_DISJOINT.DESCRIPTION: skos:Concept(s) connected to another with both the skos:exactMatch and one of skos:broadMatch or skos:relatedMatch (skos:exactMatch relation is disjoint with skos:broadMatch and skos:relatedMatch)

HIERARCHICAL_REDUNDANCIES.NAME: Hierarchical redundancies
HIERARCHICAL_REDUNDANCIES.DESCRIPTION: skos:Concept(s) that have redundant hierarchical relations with another concept
HIERARCHICAL_REDUNDANCIES.SAME_SCHEME_INFO: If active, the check is performed only to the relations between Concepts belonging to the same ConceptScheme
EXAMPLE: 3rd statement is redundant since it is a consequence of 1) and 2)

CYCLIC_HIERARCHICAL_CONCEPTS.NAME: Cyclic hierarchical concepts
CYCLIC_HIERARCHICAL_CONCEPTS.DESCRIPTION: skos:Concept(s) that compose a hierarchical cycle through the skos:narrower and skos:broader relations

NO_SKOS_PREFLABEL.NAME: No skos:prefLabel resources
NO_SKOS_PREFLABEL.DESCRIPTION: skos:Concept(s) or skos:ConceptScheme(s) that don't have any skos:prefLabel

NO_SKOSXL_PREFLABEL.NAME: No skosxl:prefLabel resources
NO_SKOSXL_PREFLABEL.DESCRIPTION: skos:Concept(s) or skos:ConceptScheme(s) that don't have any skosxl:prefLabel

NO_MANDATORY_LABEL.NAME: No mandatory label resources
NO_MANDATORY_LABEL.DESCRIPTION: Resources that don't have any label in the given languages

ONLY_ALTLABEL.NAME: Only alternative label resources
ONLY_ALTLABEL.DESCRIPTION: Resources that have an alternative label but not a preferred in the same language

NO_LANGTAG_LABEL.NAME: No language tag label resources
NO_LANGTAG_LABEL.DESCRIPTION: Resources that have a label without language tag

OVERLAPPED_LABEL.NAME: Overlapped label resources
OVERLAPPED_LABEL.DESCRIPTION: Resources that have the same label in the same language duplicated as pref, alt or hidden label

CONFLICTUAL_LABEL.NAME: Conflictual label resources
CONFLICTUAL_LABEL.DESCRIPTION: Resources or, specifically, concepts in the same scheme, that have the same preferred label in the same language

EXTRA_WHITESPACE_LABEL.NAME: Extra whitespace label resources
EXTRA_WHITESPACE_LABEL.DESCRIPTION: Resources that have some extra whitespace in a label

MULTIPLE_PREFLABEL.NAME: Multiple preferred labels resources
MULTIPLE_PREFLABEL.DESCRIPTION: Resources that have multiple preferred labels in the same language

DANGLING_SKOSXL_LABEL.NAME: Dangling skosxl:Label(s)
DANGLING_SKOSXL_LABEL.DESCRIPTION: skosxl:Label(s) that are not linked with any skos:Concept

NO_DEFINITION.NAME: No definition resources
NO_DEFINITION.DESCRIPTION: Resources that don't have any skos definition in the given language(s)

BROKEN_ALIGNMENTS.NAME: Broken alignments
BROKEN_ALIGNMENTS.DESCRIPTION: Alignment where the object resource doesn't exist or is deprecated
BROKEN_ALIGNMENTS.RELOAD_INFO: The types of resource to check are changed, is highly recommended to reload the namespaces
BROKEN_ALIGNMENTS.NAMESPACES_TO_CHECK_INFO: Namespaces of the resources that appear as object of mapping relations

BROKEN_DEFINITIONS.NAME: Broken definitions
BROKEN_DEFINITIONS.DESCRIPTION: Definitions of resources where the object resource doesn't exist or is deprecated
BROKEN_DEFINITIONS.DEFINITION_PROP_INFO: The ICV checks for resources with broken definitions linked by means this property or its subProperties

INVALID_URI_LOCAL_RES.NAME: Invalid URI local resources
INVALID_URI_LOCAL_RES.DESCRIPTION: Locally defined resources whith syntactically invalid URI

INVOCATION.TEMPLATE_INFO: A template for rendering an individual section. The template must conform to Mustache templating language
INVOCATION.NO_PARAM_OPERATION_INFO: This operations has no parameters, it can be invoked without any configuration
INVOCATION.INVALID_UPDATE_OPERATION: Invokable reporter cannot define a service invocation that executes and update, it can only exploit read-only Custom Operations. The selected operation is not a read operation, so it cannot be used.

DATASET_METADATA.NO_AGGREGATION_INFO: If checked it means that the aggregation may be supported, but its support is insufficient for the purposes of Vocbench

NAMESPACES_AND_IMPORTS.RESOLVE_WITH_PREFIXCC: Try to resolve prefix using prefix.cc

ONTOLOGY_MIRROR_MANAGER.UPDATE_FROM_WEB_ALT_URL: Update from web from alternative URL

ONTOLOGY_IMPORT.DATA_DUMP_CHECK: If checked, import is added from the provided data dump instead of the ontology IRI

FROM_OPT.WEB_FALLBACK_MIRROR: Resolve from web with fallback to Ontology Mirror
FROM_OPT.MIRROR_FALLBACK_WEB: Resolve from Ontology Mirror with fallback to Web

OTHER.SHOW_FLAGS_INFO: Determines if the flags icon are shown in place of the language ISO code
OTHER.PROJECT_THEME_INFO: Changes the color of the header/navigationBar for the current project

EDITING.DESCRIPTION: Select the language prompted by default when creating a new language-tagged literal

RENDERING.DESCRIPTION: Select the languages (and their order) used for rendering the resources

VALUE_FILTER.DESCRIPTION: Select the languages that will be shown when filtering literal values in resource descriptions. Toggle the filter in order to hide the values with the unselected languages.

NOTIFICATIONS.TYPE_EVENT_NOTIFICATIONS_INFO: For each type of resource you can select the events for which you want to receive notifications
NOTIFICATIONS.ENABLE_ALL_FOR_TYPE: Enable all actions for this type
NOTIFICATIONS.DISABLE_ALL_FOR_TYPE: Disable all actions for this type
NO_RESOURCE_WATCHING_MSG: You did not enabled notifications on any resources. You can start watching resources by clicking on the
button placed on the toolbar of a ResourceView.

MODES.NO_NOTIFICATIONS_INFO: You will not receive any notification
MODES.IN_APP_INFO: You will be able to read notifications only in app from a dedicated page
MODES.EMAIL_DAILY_INFO: You will receive a daily email report

RES_VIEW.TABBED_INFO: The Resource View is shown in a tab and multiple Resource View can be open in different tabs.
SPLITTED_INFO: The Resource View panel is splitted in two: on the left there is a main Resource View which describes (and is synched with) the resource selected in the tree/list; on the right there is an optional secondary Resource View which describes a resource selected (double click) from the main Resource View
This mode is not recommended in screen with resolution width below 1440px
RES_VIEW.SYNC_WITH_TREE_LIST: Keep selected tab synchronized with tree/list
RES_VIEW.SYNC_WITH_TREE_LIST_WARNING: It is recommended to disable this option. The synchronization between tabs and tree/list could slow down the navigation of the ResourceView tabbed panel.
RES_VIEW.INITIAL_VIEW_FOR_CONCEPTS_INFO: This selection will be used by default for browsing SKOS concepts. The user can switch to other views during their session of work, but this selection will be applied as an initial setting at each new login
RES_VIEW.DISPLAY_IMAGES_INFO: If enabled, URL values resolvable to images on the web will be displayed as images (preview) in the ResourceView
RES_VIEW.SHOW_DEPRECATED_INFO: If enabled, linked resources marked as deprecated will be shown in the ResourceView
RES_VIEW.SHOW_DATATYPE_BADGE_INFO: If enabled, a datatype badge will be always shown beside the value. If not, the badge is only shown in case of an unknown datatype (the icon on the left of the value will classify the known datatype)

PROJECTS.BLACKLIST_INFO: Enable this to blacklist terms that have been rejected through validation
PROJECTS.HISTORY_INFO: Enable this to keep track of the changes made on the working graph
PROJECTS.INFERENCE_DISCOURAGED_INFO: It is highly recommended not to use inference
PROJECTS.LEFT_RIGHT_INFO: Due to technology limitations, the two datasets must be remote
PROJECTS.USE_RESOURCE_METADATA_INFO: Usage of Resource Metadata can be enabled also after the project creation
PROJECTS.VALIDATION_INFO: Enable this to keep track of change requests in order to validate them later (accepting or rejecting)

PRELOAD.SELECTION_AUTO_DETERMINED: This selection has been automatically determined on the basis of the preloaded data; modify it only if you know what you are doing
PRELOAD.SELECTION_UNDETERMINED: Preload operation could not determine this selection. Please provide it manually

CONFIG.PROJ_INFO_INFO: Here you can show or hide info about the projects and customize their order.

RESOURCE_METADATA.DESTRUCTION_PATTERN_INFO: Please notice that when the resource is deleted, all of its outgoing triples will be automatically deleted, so developing a destruction pattern is only necessary in case there are other resources linked by this resource (and only by it) that should thus be deleted in turn (this happens, e.g., in the case of reified metadata)

FILTER.SET_VISIBLE_FOR_ALL: Set visible for all resource types
FILTER.SET_VISIBLE_ALL: Set visible all the partitions of all the Resource types

ACTIONS.ASSIGN_TO_ISSUE: Assign this resource to existing issue
ACTIONS.SPAWN_CONCEPT_FROM_XLABEL: Spawn new concept from this xLabel
ACTIONS.BULD_EDIT_INFO: Update the value for every resource that has this predicate-value relation
ACTIONS.SPAWN_FROM_XLABEL: Spawn new concept from this xLabel
ACTIONS.BULK_DELETE_INFO: Delete the value for every resource that has this predicate-value relation

STATUS.RESOURCE_NOT_EXISTING: This resource is not available in the current project
STATUS.RESOURCE_UNKNOWN_HOST: This resource is not available on accessible local projects nor can be reached on the Web

MISC.INVERSE_PROPERTY_MULTIVALUE_WARN: In case of multiple properties selected, the 'Inverse Property' flag is applied to all of them (available only if all ObjectProperties)

CODE_EDITOR.DISABLED_UNDER_VALIDATION: The Code view tab has been disabled as this resource - or part of its description - is under validation

METADATA_UNAVAILABLE_LOCAL_WARNING.METADATA_NOT_AVAILABLE: VoID/LIME Metadata not available for local project '{{projName}}'. Click

ASSISTED_SEARCH.METADATA_UNAVAILABLE_REMOTE_WARNING: VoID/LIME Metadata not available for remote dataset '{{datasetUriSpace}}'. You need to generate/add 'Embedded Lexicalization Sets' from the Metadata Registry management in order to exploit this feature.
ASSISTED_SEARCH.PAIRED_LEX_SETS_INFO: Lexicalization sets shared between the source resource and the target project/dataset
ASSISTED_SEARCH.REFRESH_METADATA_INFO: Refresh metadata of the target project
ASSISTED_SEARCH.PERCENTAGE_INFO: Percentage of resources that have a lexicalization in the given language
ASSISTED_SEARCH.NO_SEARCH_MODE_SELECTED_WARNING: If none is selected, 'Fuzzy' and 'Contains' are used by default
ASSISTED_SEARCH.SEARCH_MODE_INFO: String match modes on which the lexicalizations comparison is based on

CUSTOM_SEARCH.SHOW_HIDE_SPARQL_DETAILS: Show/hide SPARQL details about the custom search
CUSTOM_SEARCH.NO_PARAM_SEARCH: This search has no parameters so can only be run as is.

SETTINGS.SEARCH_MODE_INFO: Search always looks for the input string among the lexicalizations
SETTINGS.INCLUDE_LOCALES: Include locales in search (e.g. en-GB, en-US)
SETTINGS.AUTOCOMPLETION_INFO: It is highly recommended to disable this feature in big project not hosted by a GraphDB server
SETTINGS.RESTRICT_TO_SCHEME: Restrict the search to the active skos:ConceptScheme(s)
SETTINGS.EXTEND_TO_ALL: Extend the search to all the individuals (also belonging to other classes)

EXPORT.TRANSFORMATION_INFO: Here it is possible to create and configure a sequence of transformations to be applied during the export process.
EXPORT.UNCONFIGURED_FILTER: This filter needs to be configured

NO_USER_REGISTERED_MSG: VocBench found no registered user. In order to use the platform, you need to create an administrator account by entering personal data and login credentials. A pre-defined user
is available for letting those willing to use VocBench as a simple desktop tool and skip the user creation procedure.

MANCHESTER.TABLE_CONSTRUCTORS_INFO: This table shows the conversions between DL syntax and Manchester syntax for these constructors
MANCHESTER.TABLE_AXIOMS_INFO: This table shows the conversions between DL syntax and Manchester syntax for these axioms

SETTINGS_RENDERER.UNKNOWN_TYPE_WARN: This parameter has an unknown type ({{propTypeName}}). The entered value will be interpreted as a low-level JSON value

VALUE_PICKER.PICK_FROM_EXTERNAL_PROJ: Pick a resource from external project

LANGUAGE.NO_LANG_INFO: No language selected implicitly means all languages
